utt: We've managed to reduce our energy consumption in our factory by about 15 per cent in the last two years.

utt: Mainly because we've invested in a heat recovery system.

utt: What does that mean exactly?

speaker: speaker_1

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We're hoping to use even more energy from alternative sources in the future - perhaps even wind power.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Perhaps you'd be interested in red roses.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: What would the roses cost me?

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: They're only $ 20 a dozen.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I like the sound of that.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, that is today's sale price.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: A dozen will be fine.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Is there anything else you'd like to get?

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, thank you.

id_and_goal: 18: [1] ask about other_1 [2] flower recommendation_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: These roses should make your wife very happy.

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Room service, is there anything I can do for you?

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I am afraid there are not enough outlets.

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, we have 6 for each room.

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, but 4 of them are broken.

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can you send someone here?

id_and_goal: 19: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK sir, please wait a minute.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why'd you pull me over?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Are you aware that you drove through a red light?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I ran a red light?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, you did.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I apologize, but I didn't realize that I did.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Weren't you taught that yellow means slow down, not speed up?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I did learn that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So, then why did you speed up?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't know what to tell you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm going to have to write you a ticket.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I understand.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here you go.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Don't do that again.

id_and_goal: 21: [1] ask about other_1 [2] other_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_2 [5] ask about other_3

utt: Surely of course.

utt: Can I get my pictures tomorrow?

id_and_goal: 21: [1] ask about other_1 [2] other_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_2 [5] ask about other_3
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sure.

id_and_goal: 21: [1] ask about other_1 [2] other_1 [3] ask about other_2 [4] other_2 [5] ask about other_3
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Besides I want two copies of all the photos.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Tell me a little bit about yourself, please.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My name is Dunlin and I live in Beijing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I was born in 1980.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I will graduate from Peking University this July.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have majored in accounting.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Would you tell me something about your family?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There are three in my family, my parents and myself.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My father is a teacher and my mother is a worker.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I really need to start eating healthier.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have to start eating better too.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What kind of food do you usually eat?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I try my best to eat only fruits, vegetables, and chicken.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is that really all that you eat?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's basically it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How do you stick to only those foods?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Actually, fruits and veggies are really good for you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah, I know, but what about the chicken?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I mainly eat baked chicken, because there's not a lot of fat.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That does sound pretty good.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I know it does, and that's because it is.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: what would you do without me?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This position demands a higher writing ability, so please say something about your writing ability.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Of course.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've loved writing since I was a very little boy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I won the first prize in a national composition contest when I was in middle school.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: After attending Nanjing University, I never give up writing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My works, such as Father's Tobacco Pipe, Open Air Cinema, The old City were respectively published China Youth Daily, Yangzi Evening News, and New Beijing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: During the period of studying for my degrees of master and doctor, I paid more attention to developing my research ability and published several papers.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The Impact of Internet in Chinese Political Participation, The Discipline of Remold, The Historical Direction of Chinese Administration Reform, Bribery Cases of Self governance in Chinese Villages are respectively published in Chinese Publish Administration, Beijing Due Xuebao, Theory and Society and Chinese Reform.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I joined in Yangzi Evening News to work as a part-time journalist in 2006.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: During this period, I've written a lot of comments, which improved my writing ability to a new level, I have full confidence in my writing ability, and I believe I can do the job well.

utt: That sounds like a good idea.

id_and_goal: 30: [1] other_1 [2] greeting, ask about other_1 [3] reservation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: All right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: May I have your name, Sir?

id_and_goal: 30: [1] other_1 [2] greeting, ask about other_1 [3] reservation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: My name is Ron Kollwitz.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Ms. Wang, this is Mr. Cooper, president of Ivy Publishing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's nice to meet you, Mr. Cooper.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Nice to meet you, Ms. Wang.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You must be exhausted after your long trip from Canada.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, it was quite a long flight.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm glad to finally be here.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can you help me now?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No, but I'll be able to tomorrow.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That'll be too late.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why don't you ask Bill if he can help?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I did, but he wasn't able to either.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you got any experience in advertising?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I have been working in the Public Relations Section of a company in the past two years.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I plan the advertising campaign and cooperate the work of artists and typographers.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sometimes I have to do the work of a specialist when there’s something urgent.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have any practical experience as a secretary?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I acted as a secretary in an insurance company.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Would you tell me the essential qualities a secretary should maintain?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, to begin with, I would say she needs to be diligent, and the second point is that she has to do a lot of things on her own initiative.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Finally, she can make notes in shorthand and types and has the skills in report writing, summary writing, keep minutes at meetings, and so on.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Most important of all is that she seems to have a better memory than average.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you had any experience with computer?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I studied in a computer training program, and can process data through the computer.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's fine.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What about operating the fax and duplicator?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can handle them without any trouble

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What have you learned from jobs you have held?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Above all, I have learned that what is good for the company is good for me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So I follow the instructions strictly and always keep my boss informed.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Very good.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why did you take that money?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You are such a cheater!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I should send you to jail!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I am not cheating.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: When you pass go, you collect $ 200, Everyone knows that!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well you can’t just take the money.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You have to ask the bank for money.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And I’m the banker.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Banker?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes...

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can I have my $ 200 please?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sure.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here you are, $ 200, Thank you, please come again!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Now it’s my turn to roll the dice.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi, is this Professor Clark’s office?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: This is Professor Clark speaking.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi, this is Kalina from your morning literature class.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, what can I do for you?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I had a skydiving accident over the weekend and won’t be able to come to school today.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My goodness! Are you OK?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I broke my leg, but it is healing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How long will you be out of class?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I should be able to return by next Monday.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Fine. Well, thanks for calling and letting me know you will be absent.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I hope you feel better soon.

utt: Is it expensive?

id_and_goal: 40: [1] greeting_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1 [4] nan_1 [5] nan_2 [6] nan_3 [7] nan_4
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let’s see... I would say about eight hundred dollars.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Listen, Karen, I need your help.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't know anyone here yet.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm glad to help you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What's wrong?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My mother-in-law just went into the hospital in L.A. Hank and I will be flying there tonight.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm sorry to hear it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What's wrong with her?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Doctors aren't sure yet.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But the real problem is Suzy.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She has a bad cold, and we don't want to take her with us.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You need a babysitter.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, I'd ask Jill, the girl I've had before, but I need someone overnight.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I could have Suzy stay at my place.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't want to do that to you, Karen.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why not?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Your own kids would get Suzy's cold.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think it would be better to have a good babysitter here.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But I don't know who to ask.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I need someone more mature than Jill.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It might even be for two or three days.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I know who we can ask.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There is a girl I know, Sara Ralston.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She is 17, and she will usually take this kind of job.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'd like to talk with her.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This is short notice, I know.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll get you her number.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I hope she can do it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She is very responsible.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm glad you know someone.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I knew you would be the best person to ask about this.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't want to insult Jill or her mother.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think Jill maybe could do it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll go home and get Sara's number.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll call her first myself.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Great.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then call me and let me know if she's free.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good evening.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What'll you have?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'd like a beer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What kind of beer do you have?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Draft beer and cans beer.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Which do you prefer?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: A draft beer please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here you are.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Could I have some fruit?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Of course.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wait for a moment, please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hello, Mr. Black, how are you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Fine, thank you, and how are you?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Very well, thank you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's nice to meet you again.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am awfully sorry for not being able to meet you at the airport, as I was busy yesterday.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I do hope you had a very enjoyable trip from New York.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, a very pleasant journey indeed.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How are you getting along with your business?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not bad.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The fur market is not very brisk lately, but the selling season is advancing near.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I hope there will be more buyers in the market this year.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I hope we can do more business together.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Though we are satisfied with our past trade record, there are still possibilities for more business.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: In the meantime, let's discuss other spheres of cooperation, such as investment, technology transfer and technical assistance.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: By the way miss, where is the toilet?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Toilets are in the rear, I am afraid all the toilets are fully occupied at the moment.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, what we live!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you very much for your help, miss.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You are welcome.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'll be willing to come and talk about the financing of our imports.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It can be solved by drawing a draft on us at 90 days sight.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What about a draft at 120 days sight?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: All right.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But we demand the draft be accepted by a bank acceptable to us.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: A bank's acceptance will add to the costs of our imports.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can rest assured that we will accept the draft and honour it when it comes due.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Then we will be in a position to arrange for a loan from our bank.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know we exports would like to have our investments returned as early as possible.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I hope this transaction will pave the way for further business relations between our two countries.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So do I.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There's a new girl in school, have you seen her yet?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I haven't seen her yet.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think that she is very pretty.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Tell me how she looks.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She's kind of short.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What height is she?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She's probably about five feet.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's nice, but tell me what she looks like.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The first thing I noticed was her beautiful brown eyes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think I might've bumped into her before.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you telling me that you've seen her before?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Take a seat inside and see what you think.

utt: Yes, and I want to buy the insurance too.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think it's necessary.

utt: You're smart to buy it.

speaker: speaker_1

utt: Can I return the car in San Francisco?

utt: San Francisco?

utt: No, sir.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We only have this office here.

utt: Really?

utt: I heard in America you can return rental cars in different cities.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, sir.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's only with the very big companies.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm sorry, but this car must be returned to this lot.

utt: Well, I guess I will have to drive back down then.

utt: Hmm.

utt: I didn't think of that.

utt: Yes.

utt: It will be fun.

utt: Sure.

utt: Just leave it to me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll finish it.

utt: Look at the show on TV.

utt: I am watching a food show at a very famous seafood restaurant.

utt: I really want to eat at that restaurant.

utt: I am a seafood lover.

utt: Speaking of seafood, my mouth is watering.

utt: Sound great.

utt: Let's go!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Tom, is Jenny crying?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can you take her away from me?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’m just coming for that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She kept bothering me.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She’s your sister.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But I am her brother, not her servant.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wow!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Your fruit looks really fresh!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How much are these apples?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The apples are 30NT each.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How many would you like?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let's see, 30NT is about... almost a dollar US.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What?!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How about these pineapples?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They're 250NT each, but they're not edible.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They're only used for worship.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hmm, 250NT is... 8 dollars?!!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And you can't even eat them?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You're crazy!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Wait!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Don't go just yet.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: These bananas are pretty cheap--only 35NT for this bunch.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Now that's more like it!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Bananas have lots of potassium, too!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They're also good for your digestion!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Would you like some kiwis, too?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are they from Taiwan?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They're imported from New Zealand.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Four for 50NT.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Nine for a hundred.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'll take four kiwis.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Amelia, could you spare a few minutes?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: sure.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What do you need?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: well, I wanted to let you know that I've put in my notice.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: really?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: it's complicated.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But basically it boils down to one thing.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This company is downsizing and I can't continue working for a company that may let me go.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: but surely they won't fire you!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You're one of the most experienced managers here!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: well, to be honest, there's another reason.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I've got a better offer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: well that's great news!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Congratulations!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Where will you be located?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: the head office is in New York, but I'll be dealing with overseas companies and flying to this side of the world from time to time.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: it'll be sad to see you go, but it sounds like you've found yourself a great opportunity.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I have.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I feel lucky.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I look forward to dealing with overseas companies and at the same time having a chance to use English more.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm sorry to bring this up, but would it be possible for you to write me a letter of recommendation before you go?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: of course I can.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: In fact, if there are other job opportunities at this new company, I'll recommend you personally.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: thanks.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I appreciate that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How come it is slow as a snail today?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You mean the network connection?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, I wanted to look for some information on the company page just now.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It took me almost one minute to open it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then there is no response to any click.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have the same question.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can’t send out mails.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We’d better call the IT department and ask them to check it immediately.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Ok.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Honey, I need to have a talk with you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Dad, I have to do my homework.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, honey, why didn't you go to cram school last night?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Dad, I don't want to talk about it now.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Honey, if you don't want to go to cram school, you should tell me the reason why.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm sorry, dad.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But I would rather stay at school than go to cram school.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What's wrong with you, young man?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Doctor, I have a bad cough and a headache.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have a fever?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't know, but I feel terrible.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let me examine you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Don't worry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's nothing serious.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you think I should lie in bed?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, stay in bed and drink a lot of water.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Your fever will be gone in a day or two.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you think I can play football tomorrow?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Of course not.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You need a good rest.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I want something sweet after dinner.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What do you have in mind?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: A dessert sounds nice.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What kind are you thinking of getting?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I want to get some pie.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What kind of pie do you want?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I have no idea.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you want to know what kind of pie I like?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sure, what kind do you like?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I love apple pie.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, I love apple pie too.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There you go.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Problem solved.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let's go now.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll be with you in a minute.

utt: May I help you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you exchange foreign money here?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Our bank is authorized to deal with foreign exchange.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What kinds of currency do you change?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We can change only three kinds of currency, USD, Japanese Yen and HK Dollar in our savings office.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Could you tell me what the exchange rate for USD is today?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The buying rate is 826.44 yuan for 100 dollars.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I want to change some Us dollars to cover my expense here.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Please go to Counter No. 2, the foreign exchange counter.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's over there.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you.

utt: What can I get for you today?

utt: Oh, dear.

utt: This is our sale period.

utt: It’s still too much.

utt: Can’t you make it any cheaper than that?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can’t get it any cheaper than here.

utt: I see.

speaker: speaker_1

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Mr. Crandall, I’m sorry, but I really don’t see the value in doing this entire project over from scratch.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It would take a lot of work.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That’s certainly true.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But, that’s what this job is all about, Maria.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There's no doubt that this project is unacceptable.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I agree.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But I think that we can handle the problem by making a few major changes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’d appreciate it if you would give me a chance.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: All right, Maria.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I’ll give you until tomorrow at 4:00 to produce a satisfactory piece of work, but otherwise, you’ll have to re-do it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You do?

utt: How are you going to contact him?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm leaving him a message taped to my computer screen.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you think he'll see it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He'll see it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It says, I like sweets. Meet me at two thirty in the parking lot.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can I spy on you guys from the window?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But I'll fill you in later.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Right now I have to find Vince.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There's plenty left.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Would you like another helping?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'd like to have some more.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's really good.

utt: You guys are charging me $ 10 for a movie that I never ordered or saw.

utt: Let's see, sir.

utt: According to your file, you watched' Titanic' Monday evening.

utt: I was at a concert Monday night.

utt: Well, your word overrules the file, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: One moment, please.

utt: I knew you'd see it my way.

utt: Sir, I deleted the $ 10, but I had to add a $ 2 service charge to your bill.

utt: Am I in the Twilight Zone?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You're charging me for a movie I never saw?

utt: Please don't blame me, sir.

utt: This is highway robbery.

utt: I've got a good mind to call the police!

utt: The main topic on today's agenda is the development of a U. S. sales strategy for the new EBB.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What should be included in my CV?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Generally speaking, a CV or resume is made up of 6 parts, personal information, educational experience, practical experience, personal skills, self-evaluation and job intentions.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What kind of personal information?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Including your name, sex, date of birth, height, phone number, and so on.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: May I come in?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, please.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I’m Mr. Peter, the Director of Personnel.

utt: Please wrap them up tor me and give me the receipt.

utt: Good morning.

utt: This is room 113.

utt: Hi, Sam.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I want to buy a pet.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have any ideas?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You really should go to Rachel's pet store.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: anything special there?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's more than special.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can find as many kinds of animals as you can put a name to and more.

utt: Oh, really?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: are there any snakes?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Snakes?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: there are even rodents and monkeys!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: it's a world of exotic pets.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's terrific.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I can't wait to check it out.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hang on.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: are you sure you want to keep a non-traditional pet?

utt: Why not?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: it's so cool.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But it will pose a risk to your health.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Pardon?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I mean, most reptiles carry some harmful bacteria, they are likely to cause immune system problems.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, I didn't realize that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't believe it's a good choice to keep those pets, especially for families with young children.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, I should have thought of my brother's baby girl.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Maybe I'll just have a dog instead of an exotic pet.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, good luck, Maria.

utt: Hello, this is room 1205.

utt: Our message lamp is flashing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hold on a minute, please.

utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I am sorry to have kept you waiting.

utt: Would you bring the message to my room.

utt: Then I'll come down and pick up the message immediately.

utt: OK, we wait for you.

utt: guess what?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I've got great news!

utt: what is it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: well, you know how I've been working at the Economist as a proof-reader, right?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: well, the editor-in-chief heard that I had experience as an editor at another magadize and asked me if I was interested in becoming an assistant editor for him.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: really?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's fantastic!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Will you get a chance to do any writing?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: she said that the columnist for the literary criticism column would be going on pregnancy leave soon and that I could be in charge of the column until she came back.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: wow!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's really great news.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How often does the magazine come out?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: it's a monthly magazine, but my column will be shared with another columnist so my articles will be due fortnightly.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: are you looking forward to doing more editing work?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: yes, but I'm even more excited about getting my thoughts published again!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: do you have any order forms here so that I can get a subscription to the magazine?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't have any with me, but I think I could manage to bring a free copy home for you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm really looking forward to reading your column.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: me, too.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you want to go out to celebrate my good news?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: sure, where would you like to go?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hey, could you help me try and figure out how to get ready for my job interview?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: The most important thing to do is to make sure you know the company and what services or products it provides.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you know all about them?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, I pretty much understand the company.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, after you've done your research, you have to decide whether the company is casual or formal.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Have you decided what they are yet?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, I've been observing them.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: When you are choosing what to wear, keep all of that in mind.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Have you chosen what to wear?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I already have something to wear.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I would always be ready to go shopping with you!

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Should we talk about other basics?

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK, I am ready to think of other things.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: You need to make sure you arrive on time, smile, be pleasant and friendly, look the person in the eye and answer all questions to the best of your ability.

id_and_goal: 261: [1] ask about other_1 [2] job interview preparation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: You'll do great!

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is there anything I can do for you?

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Would you please show me that mural?

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Certainly.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here you are.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: It looks so beautiful.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: How much is it?

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Four hundred yuan.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's a bit more than I wanted to pay.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can you cut the price down a bit?

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm sorry.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Ours is a fixed price shop and I can assure you this is the best price you can get for a mural like this.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Maybe you are right.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK, I'll take it.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, I'll have it wrapped for you.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here is four hundred yuan.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you.

id_and_goal: 262: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] mural_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Please come again.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wow, Amy, look at that number.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What's so great about it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What do you mean?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's a scrim.

utt: Not to me, I wouldn't be caught dead in that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I love that kind of stuff.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah, you seem to like those styles.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sure do.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I get a kick out of looking punk.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: This one looks really expensive though.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't care how much it costs.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm rolling in it.

utt: Lucky you!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can't buy anything else.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm flat broke.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I got a replace my party outfit, I trashed it last week.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why did you drag me into this?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've spent a week salary.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you on the level?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You're the one who called me, remember?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just joking, Tonia.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've got some wonderful clothes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let's go and have a close look at your outfit.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I have just received your note which informs me that you have offered the accountant position to another candidate.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: May I ask why I was defeated?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We have thought of you carefully with discretion, but the other candidate has more experiences.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Experience is important, but don't you think capability is more valuable than that?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I think so.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But how do you prove to me that you are more capable?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Maybe you can hire me on trial.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If I'm not qualified for the job, you can let me go.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Good idea.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Excuse me, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, the nearest one is at the third cross of this road.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm a stranger here.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just walk down the road for a few minutes, and you'll find it on your right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you very much.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Unfortunately, according to our regulations I have to confiscate these counterfeit notes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So, this 500 RIB is worthless?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm sorry but it is our regulation, so I must follow it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We will issue you with a receipt to show that the notes you presented us with are counterfeit and have been confiscated.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then, if you wish to pay in some more cash, you are free to do so.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Right, I see.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let me give you another 500 RIB.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here's your Passbook back and the receipt to say we confiscated the 500 RIB worth of counterfeit notes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thanks.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Now can I make the full deposit?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Please fill in a new deposit slip and we can continue.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Ok, honey, time to take down the Christmas tree.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do we have to?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Come on, it’s losing needles all the time and the branches are sagging.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It’s not that bad, besides it really looks nice in that corner.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It gives the room a good atmosphere.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: A good atmosphere?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The tree is falling apart, and it’s messing up the room.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But it makes the place feel so much like Christmas.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I’d really hate to have to take it down.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But Christmas was two weeks ago!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It’s been there only because we’ve been too busy to get rid of it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I know, but it seems like such a shame to have to take it away.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But it’s falling apart, and the cat keeps playing with the lower branches.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I know, I know.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But it reminds me of the great Christmas we just had.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: All of us were here - - my parents, your parents, the kids, and the cousins - - the food was good, and everybody got what they wanted.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah, it was a good Christmas.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It won’t always be this good, but we can’t make it last longer than it should.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Ok, fine.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We need to take down the tree.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’ll make a deal with you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We’ll leave it up until Sunday, and then we’ll take it down after church.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: So tell me, what's the difference between the Board of Directors, the CEO, and the stockholders?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: They all seems to be the same group of people to me...

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No, there's a definite difference.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know, the stockholders are the people who own the company... they're the financial control system.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Then there's the CEO — the chief executive officer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He's the hot shot, the main guy who is the boss.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If there is only one person with absolute power in the organization, everyone knows that the power will go to their head.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's too dangerous.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's the reason for a Board of Directors.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The board is made up of people who are experts in the industry.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They could be related to the organization, but more commonly, they are independent and non-biased.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How many people are on the board of directors?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Usually not more than 15, not less than 10.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They meet monthly, quarterly, or biannually to oversee an organization or company.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They provide long term planning and vision, and also act as moral watchdogs to keep the company in line.

utt: I'm not going to buy one.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You're not?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think it's a waste of money.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It actually costs less if you have a bus pass.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How is that?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can use it however many times you need to.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Is that right?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yup, and you can keep the money in your pocket.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That sounds nice.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You should go get yours.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah, I think I will.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sure.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I usually have my lunch here.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: The food is tasty and they offer a big variety.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let's line up.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_1
utt: The steak is very inviting.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'll have it.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll have ham and egg with French fries.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: What dessert do you want?

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2

utt: Banana pie.

id_and_goal: 305: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] food recommendation_1 [3] chitchat about other_2

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you like cooking?

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I love it.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I really enjoy creating a meal from various ingredients and watching my friends enjoy it.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don’t like it.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: It takes up too much time and I really hate having it clean up after the meal.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can ask the guests for help.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: My guests usually insist on doing the washing up.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I just have to remind them where everything goes.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: So what kinds of dishes do you usually make?

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1

utt: I know you like Italian food.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1

utt: Italian, Indian and chinese.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1

utt: Do you find it hard to get ingredients for Chinese food?

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not at all.

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: How long does it take you to cook a meal for 5 or 6 people?

id_and_goal: 306: [1] chitchat about other_1 [2] ask about cooking_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Obviously, it depends on what I’m cooking.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm searching for an old music box.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You came to the right place.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Any particular decade?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If you had a box made in the' 20s, that would be nice.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We just got one in yesterday, so now we have six.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Would any of them have dancing figures?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, we still have two boxes left that have dancing figures.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, they're both so beautiful.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let me have this one, I think.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That one truly is a beautiful piece of work, isn't it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: One last question

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, no.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Everything we sell here is " as is. "

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I guess I was asking for too much.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If it breaks down, maybe you can find a repairman on the Internet.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We have been over this a hundred times!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We are not getting a pet!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why not?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Come on!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just a cute little puppy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: or a kitty!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Who is going to look after a dog or a cat?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I will!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I’ll feed it, bathe it and walk it every day!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We can get a Labrador or a German Shepard!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What if we want to take a vacation?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Who will we leave it with?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Plus, our apartment is too small for that breed of dog.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Ok.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How about we get a cat or a ferret?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We’re planning on having children soon, I don’t think those animals are a good idea with a baby in the house.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Fine!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let’s get a bird then!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We can keep it in its cage and teach it to talk!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: A parrot would be awesome!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’ll tell you what, I can get you some hamsters and we’ll take it from there.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yay!

utt: Certainly.

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: We have here the race apparatus, stationary bike, muscle builder set, chest expander, bar bell, dumb bell and so on.

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Working in the gym is a very good way for losing weight.

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: What else do you have?

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here's the swimming pool.

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's open from 10 a. m. to 11 p. m. There are also massage rooms here.

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's wonderful!

id_and_goal: 309: [1] other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] chitchat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I like swimming.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: John, I was looking through some magazines for ideas about where we might go on vacation this year.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've already told my buddy, Mark, that I am going hunting with him in Alaska.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can't be serious!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hey, I've always gone hunting or fishing on vacation.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I am sorry that bothers you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: After a year together, I thought it pretty safe to assume that we would automatically spend our vacation together.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Says who?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't think that is necessarily the case.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You know, now that I think about it, I really don't have much more to say to you at all!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Whatever you say!

utt: It looks complicated.

utt: Can you give me more details on what is included in the package?

utt: Sure.

utt: The coach leaves at 6:30 a. m., in front of our office.

utt: The drive takes eight hours, with two stops to see some sights.

utt: What about the hotel accommodations?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You'll be staying at Holiday Inn.

utt: It's a three-star hotel with two restaurants and a swimming pool.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Great.

utt: What types of things will we do at Lushun Falls?

utt: The second day you take a four-hour city tour.

utt: In the afternoon you go on the famous boat cruise under the falls.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Honey, the house is such a mess!

utt: My boss and her husband are coming over for dinner and the house needs to be spotless!

utt: I’m in the middle of something right now.

utt: This can’t wait!

utt: Alright, alright.

utt: I’m coming.

utt: Great!

utt: Just a sec I’m just gonna vacuum this rug real fast

utt: Wait!

speaker: speaker_1

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good morning, sir.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can I help you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Good morning.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm interested in antiques.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you have any?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, we have a great variety of Chinese antiques.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What do you have?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, we have some painting and some porcelain.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Which do you like better?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'd like porcelain.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How about the table set?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, it looks well.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I like it very much.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's made in Jingdezhen.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How much is it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: One thousand eight hundred yuan.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's not expensive.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'll take it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, so Dalian is hotter than New York now.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not hot but warm.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Very comfortable.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you staying at the Hilton?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I have already booked a room.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Could you show me what you've got?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We've got several good chicken dishes if you like chicken.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We'll try one of your specials this time.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: This is worth trying.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Welcome to China, Mr. Smith.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So pleasant to meet you here!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I heard that you are interested in our silk skirts and new style of coats.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I've brought a list of your recent products with me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We'd like to import some of your latest clothes for the second half of this year.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We're ready to place an order with you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Great!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: B, most of the items listed are available this year.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I hope we can come to an agreement and sign the contracts, so as to enable our timely delivery.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That sounds good.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But I have a proposal now.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What's the proposal?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Both of our two parties were involved in the discussion previously.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Shall we also allow some of our clients to join us?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good idea!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: In this way, our clients' needs will be met and disagreements between the two parties avoided.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sounds like we have the same idea.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Could you please tell me how I can go job-hunting in the web?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Generally speaking, job seekers can enter the websites either of job agencies or of some units for job advertisements.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How should I contact them?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can e-mail your application materials for application to the websites of job agencies for enrollment in their database.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can I get a quick reply from the sites?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, usually it takes a short time, but you have to await the choice of the units for a while.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thanks honey!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The hotel operator.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Anything I can do for you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've been trying to get through to the booking office for the last ten minutes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But the line has been engaged all the time.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why is it taking so long?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm sorry to hear that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm afraid it is often the case during the peak hours.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Shall I ask them to call you when the line is free?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Please do so if it is not troublesome.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No trouble at all.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: May I know your name and room number?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm Du Juan, in Room 312.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I see.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wait in the room, please.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you for your kindness.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let's have seafood for a change.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I couldn't agree more!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Anything else you want to add?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, yeah, two beers.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: May I see your ticket and passport, PLS?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sure, here they are.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Any luggage?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just this suitcase.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Your backpack is very big and today's flight is quite full.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am afraid that you will have to check your backpack too.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No problem.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What about this carry-on?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can take that with you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can I have an aisle seat, PLS.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No problem.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'll give you an aisle seat in the center row.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And here is your ticket, passport and boarding pass.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Please board the plane at Gate 15.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And when is the latest time for me to board the plane?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: 15mins before the plane takes off.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The plane is scheduled to leave on time.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you very much!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You are welcome!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have a nice flight.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Tell me about yourself and your past experience.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have worked as an executive secretary for 5 years, first for trading companies, and now I am working for a trust company.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I interact well with peers, clients, administrators and bosses.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I thrive on challenge and work well in high-stress environments.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How are your typing and shorthand skills?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can type 100 Chinese words a minute and take dictation in English at 150 words a minute.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can you operate computers skillfully?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I can.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have received some special training in computers.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Besides I am good at operating common office machines, such as fax machines and duplicating machines.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sometimes we are very busy and need to work overtime.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How do you feel about that?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's all right.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But could you tell me how often and how many hours I should work overtime?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It just depends.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Mr. Smith, I's like to ask you a question.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK, please.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What specific duties would I perform if I am hired?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Nothing different from a secretary's common responsibilities.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: However, you know, our company is an international trade-oriented company, can you handle English papers and write English correspondence?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I specialized in English secretary studies at college and that's one of the main parts of my present job.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What are your salary expectations?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I really need more information about the job before we start to discuss salary.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Maybe you could tell me what is budgeted for the position.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The starting monthly salary would be ¥ 2,000, with rises after the half year according to your competence.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think it's acceptable and I really like the job.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And when can I know the decision?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We'll inform you of our final decision by early July.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have any other questions?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What do you think about the equipment in our company?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We have to equip our company with a network of work stations at every office and show room as soon as possible.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I also realized this issue.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And office automation is essential.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Besides, Internet tends to be more essential now in the information age.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good idea.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: A network of work stations is helpful for our management.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And, to be frank, our copying machines are too slow; our telephone system is limited in function.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You are right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The current equipment of our offices really falls behind.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Next week, you can provide me a catalogue of new equipment.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I find that you spend little on handset charge every month.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you any trick?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's simple.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can use call transfer.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is it so simple?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sure.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know, we spend most of our time at home or in the office every day, so I receive handset calls with the hand-free telephone, so I need pay little for receiving calls.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's true.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Call transfer has many other advantages.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: When I am in places where network can't cover, such as the high building, I also use call transfer function, which transfers my calls to the hand-free telephone and I will not miss any call.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's all?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: In hospitals or on planes, handsets will interfere with some equip-ment, so we must close our handsets.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If you set call transfer, the problem will be solved.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you doing anything tomorrow morning?

utt: I'm wondering if you'd like to come to my office to discuss the new project.

utt: Tomorrow morning?

utt: What about tomorrow afternoon?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then I'll see you in the afternoon.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hello, I want to apply for the position of an usher in your restaurant.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Welcome.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: One of your duties is to know the number of the customer and accept reservation.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What else do I need to do?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You inform the people in charge and let them reserve dinning tables for guests.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’m going to be moving out soon.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You still have time on your lease.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There’s no way that I can stay here.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That’s not going to be all right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don’t understand why.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I’m going to have to keep your deposit

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why can’t I have it back?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Because you’re leaving before your lease is over.

utt: You have to give it back to me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You’re not going to get it.

utt: But I’m not able to live here anymore.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can’t help you with that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can I have my check, please.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here it is.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: 350 Yuan all together.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My son adores my new hairstyle so I suppose it is worth it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hearing you say that is a big reward for us.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And here is the receipt.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Wait!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Congratulations!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You are the lucky customer of our anniversary celebration.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wow, it's surprising.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: So what do I get?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can have a free facial and then make up for free for you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you want it now?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Probably not.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Doing that will probably take another three hours which I can't afford now.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here is our number.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Call us when you are ready to come.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You mean I should make an appointment ahead of time?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Got it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Bye for now.

utt: Yes, yes, I am sorry I won't keep you. It must get on your nerves when customers come in right at closing time. But they were such beautiful saucepans. I’d have bought them if I had made up my mind on the spot.

id_and_goal: 407: [1] greeting_1 [2] chitchat about other_1 [3] ask about other_1 [4] nan_1 [5] nan_2
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Perhaps madam, if you come back tomorrow, I could show you the whole range of kitchen ware. And there are still one or two things at the sale price.

id_and_goal: 407: [1] greeting_1 [2] chitchat about other_1 [3] ask about other_1 [4] nan_1 [5] nan_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, look! That was the one there. That is the sort of thing I was looking for. But it's not quite the color.

id_and_goal: 407: [1] greeting_1 [2] chitchat about other_1 [3] ask about other_1 [4] nan_1 [5] nan_2
speaker: speaker_1
utt: That might be the artificial lighting, madam. Of course, if you could come back in daylight, you might find it’s exactly what you are looking for.

id_and_goal: 407: [1] greeting_1 [2] chitchat about other_1 [3] ask about other_1 [4] nan_1 [5] nan_2
speaker: speaker_2
utt: There it is. That is the pattern! The set behind you. Thank goodness, they haven't been sold. And thank you so much for being so patient with me. Yes, those are the ones.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I've come to hear about your offer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We have the offer ready for you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let me check.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: 10 boxes with 50 brooches per box, at 20,000 yuan ; 20 boxes with 50 waistbands per box, at 30,000 yuan ; 15 boxes with other ornaments per box, at 7, 500 yuan, for shipment in June.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The offer is valid for five days.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I can tell you right now that your prices are a little higher than we expected.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know that the prices of the ornaments have been rising in recent years.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The prices we offer this time compare favorably with quotations you can get else where.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am afraid I can't agree with you there.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I must point out your prices are higher than the quotations we've received from other companies.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But you must take the design and quality into consideration.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know we are superior to others in design and quality.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We have various styles, which the other companies cannot catch up with.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I agree that yours are of the top.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, since your order is large enough, can you give me a rough idea?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: To have this business concluded, I should say a reduction of least 10 % would help.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Impossible.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How about 5 % off?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: A reduction of 5 % is acceptable.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: So I'm on the fifth floor?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How come this hotel has no fourth floor.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Four is an unlucky number here, Peter.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I see.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: People don't usually tip here, but you can.

utt: Did you send in your Continued Claim Form for the last period?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You need to be very careful to send that form in every two weeks if you want to get paid.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You should look at your claim form and see if it has been more than fourteen days since it was due.

speaker: speaker_2

speaker: speaker_1

speaker: speaker_2

speaker: speaker_2

utt: How do you spend your day, Helen?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, on weekdays I get up around ten.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Then I read the paper for an hour and have lunch at about noon.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Really?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What time do you go to work?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I start work at three.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And when do you get home at night?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I get home pretty late, around midnight.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: So what do you do, exactly?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm a TV announcer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Don't you recognize me?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I do the weather report on KNT!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Gee, I'm sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't watch TV.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: They don't really think you took it, do they?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't know.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I just know I've never been asked so many questions in my life.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How many of them were there?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Three-but there was one of them who kept asking really stupid questions.

speaker: speaker_1

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Our benefits usually include medical insurance, public accumulation fund and allowances.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What are the allowances?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If you go on a business trip, you will enjoy the allowance.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It is 200 yuan per day.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, I see.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And what about the vacation in our company?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: As a new-comer, you usually have five days of annual vacation.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And remember you have to fill out a request form, if you want to ask for leave.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Will our company have some recreational activities?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Of course.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: In spring and autumn, we will hold some sports actives.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And in movie seasons, we bulk purchase film tickets.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I will take it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How much?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am sure you can do better than that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sorry, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's the sale price.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, what about $ 70 with a scarf?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's my rock bottom price.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Take it or leave it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good afternoon, sir.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you made a reservation?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I am afraid not.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Are there any vacant tables?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't think so.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You have to wait for about 10 minutes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's all right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hello, Jack.

utt: I'm John.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm glad to see you!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sit down, please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Maybe you have read the contract, but I want to give you the details again before you sign the contract.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You must have a three-month internship.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I know.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: When you become a permanent employee, you will have the insurances.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You will get monthly pay and will be on eight-hour / day work shift.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Wait, will I have five insurances and one fund?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can also enjoy legal holidays and year-end bonus.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It sounds great!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If you need to work overtime, you will get twice the usual salary as overtime pay.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You have read the relevant terms of the contract.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have other questions?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How long will the induction training be?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: About two weeks.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I see.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If you don't have other questions, just sign here.

speaker: speaker_1

utt: OK.

utt: Well the problem is that the apartments in the heart of the city are usually more expensive.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I know, that's my problem.

utt: What do you think I should do?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, maybe you could get a two-bedroom apartment downtown and share the rent with a roommate.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, great idea!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: So, Monica, how do you like your new office?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, I love it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The room is spacious and clean with big windows and a lot of sunshine.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There are plants along the corridor.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Especially, I got my own desk with computer and telephone.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Such a great place!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That’s very good.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I once turn down a job offer just because the office is awful.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What was so bad about it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Small rooms, small window, a small desk shared by three people.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I would have been interrupted all the time and for sure not be able to deliver good work.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sounds bad!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Lucky you!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You didn’t take that job.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think a good office environment is also important to work efficiently.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Totally agree.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: By the way, the number of the telephone on your desk is extension 506.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can pick up your office supplies from the supply room at the end of the corridor.

id_and_goal: 494: [1] Q&A about education_1 [2] Q&A about work_1

id_and_goal: 494: [1] Q&A about education_1 [2] Q&A about work_1

id_and_goal: 494: [1] Q&A about education_1 [2] Q&A about work_1

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What type of people do you work with most effectively?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I tend to work well with people who are confident and straightforward.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What things impress you in your colleagues?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I admire and work best with people who are of good character and integrity.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I also think confidence and enthusiasm is positive in any business environment.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What are some of the things your supervisor did that you disliked?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The only thing I really don't like is to get feedback in front of others.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I want to hear good and bad feedback in private, so that I have time to think and react to the issue without other distractions.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I believe that's the fair way to improve learning or to change future behavior.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How do you organize and plan for major projects?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I love to brainstorm a best, worst, and most likely scenario.

utt: Describe an experience when you had to work under great pressure.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I had to complete an end of quarter report once while I was on the road for two consecutive weeks.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How do you manage your time in a typical day?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've always given priority to work with established clients, because they offer a better risk / return value.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Describe a time when you acted on someone's suggestion.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I changed my open office hours because several of my employees found it difficult to visit me except in the early mornings.

utt: I'm tired of all these forwards.

speaker: speaker_1

utt: Maybe we'll get some luck in thinking up something for this case.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The last thing to be ignored at a Chinese dinner table is to keep modest.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Does that suggest diners avoid speaking much?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The same is true in the West.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, absolutely not!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: On the contrary, you'll be considered a well-connected, sociable man, if you keep involved in the conversation all the time.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But always pay attention to what you say.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If the table has a senior guest, say something as upbeat and cheerful as possible.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Or maybe, you may give the floor to him and keep listening as if very interested.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You mean, keeping a low profile in the presence of the old?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That goes in like with Confucius' preachings, right?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Correct.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Show respect for the older people.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Conventionally, before the meal starts, the younger members are supposed to address each one of the elderly members of the table one by one.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Others are kept in waiting until the most venerable guest proclaim the beginning of the meal and takes the first bite.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Toasts also go to these men first before people can toast to each other.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Any other rules to observe in order to keep modest?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes, plenty of them.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Don't eat fast!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: People usually keep their dining pace accorded with others.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And all the dishes should not be eaten up completely.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Is it because that would give the host the impression that the food was insufficient?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Haha, I'm afraid it's simply because no one wishes to be too noticeable by finishing off the plate.

utt: But do not underestimate his ability to learn and reason.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I suggest you treat him with patience, affection, and respect.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If he needs to do something, like go to bed, or be washed, etc., please guide or help him to get it done, but lead him with gentleness.

speaker: speaker_2

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do not emphasize punishment for bad moods, etc.

utt: Oh.

utt: Can I leave a message please?

utt: Please tell him I'll call him at the office tomorrow afternoon.

utt: All right.

utt: Thank you very much.

utt: Congratulations.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What did you do during the interview?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Pay more attention to the external expressions, because they are important for the first impression.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good manner and style of conversation can let other feel your good self-cultivation.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good gestures and mien can let other feel very comfortable.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How can I have the good external expressions?

speaker: speaker_1

utt: what can I do for you?

utt: I want to pick up my valuables.

utt: May I have your key please?
