utt: Sure.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here you are.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here is your valuable.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is that right?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, thank you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: did you know that abortion is still illegal in many states in the USA?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: why?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I thought Americans were supposed to be more open than that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: well, for many religious people, they believe that people who abort their babies are murderers.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: do you think most people in America believe that abortion is wrong?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: no, I think it's mostly the older generation who are against abortions.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: it's no wonder there are so many teenage pregnancies in America.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: religious people blame it on pre-marital sex, not on abortion being illegal.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: what do you think about abortion?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I personally would never want to have one, but I think that since a pregnancy can affect a woman's entire life, she should have the right to decide for herself.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: do you think the fathers should have some kind of say in the matter?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I know this is going to sound sexist, but I don't think that men should have to give their approval to the mothers of their children.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: why not?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's their children, too.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: that may be true, but when a woman gets pregnant, it changes her life completely.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Men can still carry on with their lives after the birth exactly as they did beforehand.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: that might be true, but I think men should have some kind of say in the matter.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Come to think of it, you should get out your English books and catch up on your reading assignments.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But I don't have any reading assignments.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then review for your test.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You'll do even better.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And maybe reading will help you get to sleep.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Aw, Mom-you're such a drag.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You say that now, Lily, but you'll thank me later.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm your mom, and mother knows best.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm just calling to see if you have made any decision about the position.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sorry, we haven't made the decision at all.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have any idea when you might arrive at a decision?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We will let you know probably next Monday.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I hope to give you a positive reply.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm willing to wait until you have come to a decision.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you heard what happened?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Heard what?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Deborah already had her baby.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I didn't know that.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I thought you knew.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I honestly didn't know.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The baby was 8 pounds 6 ounces.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's good to hear.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Will you go and visit them?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Of course I will.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I just wanted to give you the good news.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thanks for letting me know.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How silly of you to jump out of the window!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But that was the first thing that came into my mind when I heard the shout earthquake!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why not use staircases?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The terror was not so violent at that time.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That would be too late.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Maybe the situation is too urgent.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I think I should have jumped in any case.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I need to stop eating such unhealthy foods.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I know what you mean.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've started eating better myself.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What foods do you eat now?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I tend to stick to fruits, vegetables, and chicken.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Those are the only things you eat?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's basically what I eat.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why aren't you eating anything else?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, fruits and vegetables are very healthy.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And the chicken?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's really healthy to eat when you bake it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I guess that does sound a lot healthier.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good morning!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am a new comer in our office.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Good morning!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Welcome to our office!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Nice to meet you!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My name is Grace Williams.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Nice to meet you too!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I am Peter Smith.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Today is my first day at work!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, hope you will enjoy your first day!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just ask me if you need any help.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's very kind of you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have experience in advertising?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I used to have a part-time job in advertising company.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What were your duties there?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I mostly did advertising planning.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What qualities do you think an advertising planner should have?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think an advertising planner should have active thoughts, creative talent, and be sensitive to the changes in the market.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What was the most important thing you have learned at work?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The most important thing I learned was that I must continuously improve my abilities.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Advertising is a constantly evolving trade and creativity is an important fact to success.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If I want to make in marketing in advertising industry, I can’t stop studying and creating.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The air conditioning is not working!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We need to call a handyman before we start to fry in here!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Dan is on top of that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think they are also getting the handyman to fix the bathroom toilet that keeps clogging up.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That would be convenient.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: They might as well ask him to fix the electrical wiring.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The circuit breakers keep going out all the time.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It’s really annoying!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah you are right.

utt: This office is falling apart!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Frank told me the other day that the gutters outside were clogged and that’s why the parking lot was flooded.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I know!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I was in ankle deep water trying to get to my car that day!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The handyman definitely has his work cut out for him.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have anything to do after this?

utt: No, I don't.

utt: Shall we drop in somewhere for a couple of drinks?

utt: That sounds like a good idea.

utt: I know a very interesting place.

utt: Oh, do you?

utt: Good.

utt: Today I'm writing a kind of poem called a Chinese couplet.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What does it say?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: This is an especially famous one.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It says "May the passing days bring you health and longevity. May this season of renewal find you basked in riches."

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's very nice.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is it for sale?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I never sell my artwork.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Really?

utt: Then what do you do with it?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I give it away.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Here, this one is for you.

utt: Wow!

utt: Really?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you sure?

utt: Now I'll have a lucky year!

utt: Remember, real luck must be created ( by ) yourself, and then it cannot be given or taken away...

utt: I often recalled the days when Tom and I were madly in love.

utt: Very romantic?

utt: Yeah.

utt: He always tickled my finny bone with his college stories.

utt: You married him for that reason?

utt: Definitely not.

utt: The most important thing was we loved each other.

utt: It seldom rains this summer.

utt: Because of pollution and other things, our environment has become worse and worse.

utt: You see, This time I traveled to the West.

utt: When I looked out of the windows of the rain, all the lands that I could see are as dry as a bone.

utt: It is serious.

utt: I'm looking forward to summer vacation.

utt: Me too.

utt: My granny is such a kind-hearted person.

utt: She is willing to help.

utt: She does have a heart of gold.

utt: You can say that again.

utt: Well, I have had many friends that went to a psychic and got their palms read and most of the things the psychic told her came true!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Of course it does!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They tell you general and obvious things like that you will be successful or have a big house.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think most of the times they are just scam artists.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, historically it is a practice that many cultures share.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Reading the tarot cards, in the east they would even read tea leaves!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I even heard that there are people that make you smoke a cigar, and then read your ashes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: All superstitious nonsense!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I would still like to go to one and see what he or she has to say, just for kicks.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Boy, it looks like everyone in your family is here, from young to old.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Easter's a good day for reunions.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The family goes to church together.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And after church they come here for lunch?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yup, a big potluck buffet.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And then-notice there are no children around?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah, what's up with that?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The kids wait in the house while the grownups hide these.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hide away, Yi-jun!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm happy you could make it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, I've been looking forward to seeing you.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What can I get you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'd love a gin and tonic.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Could you please help me to check out the book?

utt: Sure, what's the author's name, please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I can't remember that clearly.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It probably be Charles...

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Charles Dickens?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, no, no.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm not interested in literature.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK, do you know the title of the book?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm always absent-minded.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I remember that I've put a note in my pocket.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: So, show me the note please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I can't find it now.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, such bad luck, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Can you please name the category of the book?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let me see.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's not fiction.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's biography.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: OK, I'll search it for you.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: A moment, please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thanks.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How do you decide what grade we get?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I look at many things, attendance, quizzes, and tests.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What is the most important factor?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Obviously I look for improvement as we go along, but I would like you to do your best from the beginning.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: How can we keep track of our grades?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The final and midterm are 40 percent of your grade ; homework, attendance, and quizzes total 60 percent.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What if we can't get to school?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can only miss one class without penalty.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If we have a major problem, will you let us know?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I will be letting you know during the year if you have a major problem.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We're thinking about going to America.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Have you thought about the cost?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There is that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I believe it'll be very expensive.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This is such a beautiful day!

utt: Great for sailing!

utt: It sure is!

utt: The water looks so nice!

utt: Anchor the boat for a little while.

utt: I’m going to take a dip.

utt: I get too tired!

utt: I’ll just backstroke, it’s easier!

utt: Try kicking your legs more.

utt: That’s good.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: what was your wedding ceremony like, Abigail?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: my husband and I got married in a registry office with just two friends there as witnesses.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But then we had three parties to celebrate.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: three parties?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's quite a lot.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That must have been expensive!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: well, since my husband and I are from two different countries, and we live in a third country, we decided to have one in each country.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It wasn't actually that expensive.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: were your parents upset that they weren't there to see you get married?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I would have liked them to be there, but they couldn’t afford to fly out to see us, and we couldn't afford to fly out to see them, so they understood.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: did your husband's family get to meet your family?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: my husband's parents flew out to meet my family when we got married in my hometown, so that was great.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Some people spend ridiculous amounts of money on extravagant wedding receptions, but we agreed that wasn't important to us.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: that makes sense.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Did you go on a honeymoon?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: we waited until our one-year anniversary to go on our honeymoon to Africa.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: you really didn't have a very traditional wedding, did you?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: not at all, but we don’t have a very traditional marriage either, so it suited us perfectly!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Good afternoon, madam.

utt: How can I help you?

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1

utt: Well, I am a bit out of shape.

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1

utt: Oh, that's good news for us.

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: So what do you provide?

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: First of all, we'll design a custom-made work-out plan according to your habits.

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: How can you get that done?

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, we give each of our customers a personal trainer who is qualified.

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: And he will give you a fitness assessment and then come up with the work-out plan for your needs.

utt: What else?

id_and_goal: 663: [1] greeting_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] other recommendation_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Since everyone is different, your personal trainer will find you a suitable type of exercise equipment and teach you all the techniques to help you achieve your fitness level and goal.

utt: That's right.

utt: You know, pink, green and black could also be good for you.

speaker: speaker_2

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Did you set your clock forward for daylight savings time?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why do we have to do that?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, at the start of the spring we usually have more daylight in the mornings and less in the afternoon.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This is basically due to our position on the planet and the rotation of the earth.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: In any case, to take better advantage of the daylight available, we compensate by moving our clocks forward one hour.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I see.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That’s convenient!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I never understood things like this, such as GMT.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I never know what time zone we are in or when to change my clock!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That just stands for Greenwich Mean Time.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here in California, we are in Pacific Standard Time, that is eight time zones west of Greenwich.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Remember when we were in Beijing?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, then we were in China Standard Time, and that’s eight time zones east of Greenwich!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That’s why it was so weird traveling from Beijing to LA!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Because of the huge time difference, even though we left Beijing at noon and flew for more than eight hours, we still arrived in LA the same day at noon!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It’s like we went back in time!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The stepmother was very wicked.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She couldn't stand a happy smile on the boy's face.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: And she did her best to pull out the thorn in her flesh and the boy lost whatever made him happy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Poor child!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I didn't mean to be late.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can I come in?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What's your excuse this time?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have I used the one that my sister is sick?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, twice last week.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are you sure?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I thought I said it was my mother.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't think so.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But it could've been.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You can trust me this time.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My sister is definitely sick.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm just coming from the hospital.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: They say she might even die.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't buy your story.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Try not to have any more sick relatives this week, all right?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'll do my best.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just try to be a little more punctual in the future.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm working on it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Really!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi, Becky, what's up?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not much, except that my mother-in-law is driving me up the wall.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What's the problem?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She loves to nit-pick and criticizes everything that I do.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can never do anything right when she's around.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: For example?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, last week I invited her over to dinner.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My husband and I had no problem with the food, but if you listened to her, then it would seem like I fed her old meat and rotten vegetables.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: There's just nothing can please her.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No, I can't see that happening.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I know you're a good cook and nothing like that would ever happen.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's not just that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She also criticizes how we raise the kids.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My mother-in-law used to do the same thing to us.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If it wasn't disciplining them enough, then we were disciplining them too much.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She also complained about the food we fed them, the schools we sent them too, and everything else under the sun.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Did you watch the final last night?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: My favorite singer won!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, I love him too.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He not only sings well but also shows perseverance when he encounters difficulties in the contest.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah, he got booted after his initial performance in the audition, but he did not give up.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He then tried at another two auditions.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He had barely survived the third audition and finally got a chance to advance in the contest.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Fortunately, in the third audition, he has won popularity among the audience.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And that's when I started to notice him.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Me too.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Before he made the top three, I was so nervous.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I just fear that he might be knocked out.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah, there're so many excellent candidates out there.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Who knows which one will make it to the final?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Absolutely.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's why when he entered the final, I was so excited.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He really did a great job in the finale, especially in the PK round.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He performed so well that the majority of the audience cast their votes for him.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And the host announced that he won it all!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Come in, come in!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hi, Gary, what happened?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I was waiting for you at the theater.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why didn’t you meet me there?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I thought we were supposed to meet here.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Don’t you know our movie starts at seven?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: And we were going to meet at the theater at five to seven.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Then it doesn’t make sense to meet at the apartment.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’m sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We must have misunderstood each other.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why don’t you try to be clearer about your intentions?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You’re right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I am sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let’s go and watch the movie.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It’s okay.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don’t want to go now.

utt: We’ve already missed ten minutes of the movie.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We have another traditional holiday-the Dragon Boat Festival.

utt: When is it?

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: It falls on the fifth day of the fifth lunar month.

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1

utt: Could you tell me the origin of the two festivals?

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK.

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: The Dragon Boat Festival is a way to commemorate a great ancient poet named Quyuan.

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: On that day, people will hold a boat race as a symbol of the attempt to save him who threw himself into the river.

utt: Why do people eat rice cakes on that day?

id_and_goal: 747: [1] chat about other_1 [2] Q&A about Dragon Boat Festival_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: In order to prevent the fish from eating the poet's body.

utt: I think the most important thing is that you should be nice to yourself, like keeping housework simple, spending money on things that make life easier, buying yourself things you like, and so on.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can only be nice to others when you can be nice to yourself.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Does your husband feel the same?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He is very understanding and supportive.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I find it really hard to express myself in class.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I have lots of ideas, but they never seem to come out of my mouth.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: let me give you a little advice.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know what the topics are going to be, so prepares what you would like to say in advance.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I often do, but I’m worried about the responses from other people.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: you have to be realistic.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not everyone is going to agree with you, but people will respect your opinion and they will respect the fact that you have contributed something to the discussion.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I’m worried that what I say will not make sense.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: we could chat about the topic before class.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I could check that what you want to say is logical and it would also give you a chance to practice speaking.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: that’s a good idea.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What should I do if I am in two minds about a topic?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: that’s easy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Express possibilities.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: People will think that you are pretty smart to be able to look at the topic from more than one angle.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I didn’t realize that speaking in class could be so easy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: the most difficult thing is being able to predict what other people will say.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They will reply to your statements, but you can’t be sure how.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What's his job?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He used to be a policeman.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But Mrs.Smith hired him to find her lost son.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: He's a private eye now.

utt: Yes.

utt: I remember.

utt: As we know, mobile phones bring people great convenience and shorten the distance among friends and relatives.

utt: I've never thought of any disadvantages of the mobile phone.

utt: For instance, the mobile phone seriously distracts the attention of people from work and study.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Some people pay too much attention to their mobile phones.

utt: Actually, it's not the fault of the mobile phone.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But people should have a proper attitude towards it.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Mobile phone is a tool serving people, not the fetters restricting them.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hey Sandra, what's wrong?

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: You look furious!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I've had it with Tim!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think I'm going to quit!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: But Sandra... you love your job!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: You spent months trying to get this position.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's perfect for you!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah... I know.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: But I'm sick and tired of all the office power struggles!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: What kind of power struggles are you talking about?

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Basically, I think Tim is threatened by me.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm doing a better job than he is so he's trying to sabotage my career!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: So he talks about you behind your back?

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: He's all nice and friendly to my face.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: But the second I turn around he stabs me in the back!

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: I had a worker like that once.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: She was always taking credit for my ideas.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: I should keep a better record of my correspondence with the clients so if necessary I can prove it was my effort.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: My co-worker had a whole bunch of bad office habits.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: She liked to name-drop... we would be in a meeting and she would say, yesterday I was chatting with Tom.

id_and_goal: 847: [1] greeting, ask about other_1 [2] ask about other_1 [3] chat about other_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: She meant Tom Solomon... our CEO.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Doris, I'm glad you're home.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm terrified.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't know what to do!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What is it?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What happened?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think someone is stalking me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: No, it can't be.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Really?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Who?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I don't know.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I saw him the first time Tuesday.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He was at the cafe.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I noticed he was looking at me a lot.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Not just the usual looking, but staring.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He just kept staring at me.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What did you do?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I didn't do anything.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Finally, he left.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But then I saw him again today.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Outside the shoe store.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Near the cafe.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I went into a CD store and pretended I was looking at CD's.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Did he leave when you left?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Then I noticed he was on the sidewalk behind me.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: He was following me.

utt: I've seen it many times in textbooks and it's part of my dream to visit it.

utt: That's true.

utt: I'm forming a music band.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Do you already know how to play an instrument?

utt: Uh... Yeah!

utt: I’Ve told you a thousand times that I’m learning to play the drums.

utt: Now that I know how to play well, I would like to form a rock band.

utt: Aside from yourself, who are the other members of the band?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We have a guy who plays guitar, and another who plays bass.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I’m a singer.

utt: Perfect.

utt: So you can audition this weekend here at my house.

utt: Great!

utt: Wait here?

utt: You don’t have enough room for the amplifiers, microphones or even your drums!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: By the way where do you keep them or practice?

utt: What would you like for Christmas?

utt: I would like to have that new style Gl Joe.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you asked Santa?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes and I've written him a letter.

utt: Come on.

id_and_goal: 872: [1] ask about travel_1 [2] nan_1 [3] nan_2 [4] nan_3

utt: Don’t hesitate.

id_and_goal: 872: [1] ask about travel_1 [2] nan_1 [3] nan_2 [4] nan_3

utt: It's hard to be optimistic about things with the way the economy's headed... The trade deficit is getting larger, consumption's down, I really think we're headed for a recession.

utt: The economy has been stagnant for a while now.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We've been in a recessive state for several months already.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What worries me the most is the trade deficit.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think the government should do more to encourage exports.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Increasing exports would weaken the currency.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think the main point is economic growth.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: We need more jobs.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Factories have outsourced and moved many jobs to foreign countries.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The result is an increase in unemployment in our own country, lower consumption, lower production, and an overall feeble economy.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If more people are working, it will give the economy a boost.

utt: It's true that we should do something about unemployment, but what about inflation?

speaker: speaker_2

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That would result in inflation, which would result in a much less dynamic economy.

utt: I'm not married yet.

utt: It's my engagement ring.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, congratulations.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: When is the big date?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: In June.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Did you have the watch before getting the ring?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Actually, we bought the ring together after I got the watch.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You did a fabulous job with the selection.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's gorgeous.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Thank you so much.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What kind of watch is it?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's a Tag Heer.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If you don't mind me asking, how much do they cost?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: This one is $ 1500.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But they range from $ 600 to $ 3000.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That's why it looks so nice.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I should have figured.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You always get what you pay for.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I would rather get one nice watch instead of 20 mediocre ones.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm really mad at Bob.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What for?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Why?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi, Jack, how have you been?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Not very well.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Looks like you're feeling very down!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What happened?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Nothing.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Come on.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: For a man who's feeling so, down, there're usually two reasons.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Either his career is going downhill, or he has a broken heart.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Since you're so successful, it must be the latter.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, you're right.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I just broke up with Jane.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I thought you two were made for each other.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Well, you never know.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm ready for a commitment and want to settle down, but she says she wants to pursue her career while she's still young.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, she is not to blame.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It's always difficult to choose between career and family.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Maybe you're right.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Jack, I don't know what to say to comfort you, but cheer up!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There are plenty of fish in the sea and you'll find your soul mate, your perfect match!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah, but it's hard to forget her at moment.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You know, we were together for almost five years.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's really hard...

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you know Sally?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sally.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She is a bachelor girl.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She is an excellent designer.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Many of the company's advertisements are her child trains.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Why is she still single?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: She must have a face that would stop clock.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, quite the other way round.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She is a knock-out.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: She devotes much of her time to her career.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Excuse me.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you have the time?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: My watch is a few minutes fast.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's about six forty, I think.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Is it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Oh, no.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The concert will begin in twenty minutes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Are we too late to get there?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: If we start now, we can make it by taxi.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Did you watch the volleyball match last night?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Who won?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: China.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What is the score?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: China beat Brazil three to zero.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Wonderful.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What do you mean?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: If he was a good programmer, he should have been raking it in.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: The boss wanted to pay Bob with stock options.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But Bob didn't want to play that game again.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Again?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: At his last start-up, Bob worked for stock and no salary.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: They folded and he made zip.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Ouch.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Now he only works freelance.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Hundred bucks an hour.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You mustn't touch the wet paint, Bill.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm sorry.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I won't do it again.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Try to be more careful in future.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Look!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: you've damaged the sign.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Is this the sign?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What does it says?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: It says No smoking here.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: hi, Lander.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What's wrong?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I can hardly make ends meet these days.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: same here.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I haven't brought any new clothes for three months.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: my income remains the same but prices just continue to rise.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: true.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The news says that there is a general increase in the price of daily necessities.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: definitely.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have to spend 300 yuan more on food every month.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: the biggest price jump is for pork, so most people have to turn to chicken.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: is that inflation?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: inflation is more than just the rising prices, I guess.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But the central bank is warning about the risk of inflation.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: has the government taken some measures to curb it?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: yes.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The government has banned price hikes in some key industries like energy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: but I'm afraid the price hikes will spill over from food into other areas of the economy.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: you said it.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I think we should tighten our budget and cut our spending.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: how?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: for a start, we can take the public transport to work.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You know, running a car is a big expense.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: sounds a good idea.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK, everyone.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Gather around.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Here are the rules.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No tackling.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: No pushing.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You shouldn't grab someone else's shirt.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's a foul.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Play is stopped when the person with the ball is touched.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: You can touch them only between the shoulder and the knees.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: The touchdown lines are there and there.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK, let's play!

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Before we start, let's have a moment of silence for our fallen men.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Have you adapted to the lifestyle in China?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah, almost.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: But there is one thing.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I still wonder what privacy meant for Chinese people.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I don't mean to say that there's no privacy in China, but...

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What is it?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Some of my Chinese colleagues just share their personal stories in front of others.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: That makes you feel uncomfortable?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: we never do that in a public office.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Perhaps that's because we hold different ideas about privacy.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I have felt that.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: One day when i was in a queue, reading a newspaper story, the man behind me peered through my shoulder and stared at the newspaper I was holding.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Well, that's not rare.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I've seen people reading at others' newspaper while taking a metro or a bus.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Just stare at the newspaper holding in the hands of the one next to him?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: What qualifications should a reporter have?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: As a reporter, he must have acute insight and language skills.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: At the same time, he must have good judgment, the respect for his job and tactical cooperation with others.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can you work under pressure?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You know, people working here are all busy everyday since we're daily newspaper.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I think I've got used to work under pressure.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I will adjust myself to the step of your newspaper quickly.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Hi, good morning, Miss?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: what can I help you with?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Good morning I'd like to mail this box of books to Taiwan.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: OK, please put it on this scale.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: How long does it take to reach Taiwan by sea?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Usually about two month.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's too long.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: About ten days.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Then how much is that by airmail?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Let me see.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's a little bit expensive.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Although it's expensive to send it by airmail, it's quicker and safer than by sea.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I guess I have to send it by airmail.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you want to ensure the contents, Miss?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, please.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Please fill out this form, also please write the value of the items in this space.

utt: Excuse me, ma'am.

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Of course.

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Can you tell me where the nearest postoffice is?

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1

utt: Go straight ahead.

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1

utt: You'll see a tall, yellow building.

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Do you mean that I go that way for one block, then turn right?

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, you are right.

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1

utt: Is it far?

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1

id_and_goal: 987: [1] ask about other_1 [2] Q&A about other_1 [3] saying goodbye_1
speaker: speaker_1
utt: Thank you very much.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm in 507.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I have a few problems with my room.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: What is that problem, sir?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: There are cockroaches in my room.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Are you sure, sir?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Flies I could believe, but cockroaches?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I've counted nine different cockroaches, and I accidentally stepped on another one.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sir, we run a spotless and cockroach-less hotel.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: You dare to doubt me?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: I'm sorry, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let me transfer you to my supervisor.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Excuse me, sir, I'm afraid you can't park your car here.

utt: Why not?

utt: It's my parking space.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'm afraid not, sir.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh?

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's a surprise.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Let me see... D 0411 Our dog's birthday.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Yes, I'm sure this my parking space!

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But I saw a red car always parking here before.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Oh, we've just repainted our car.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It was red.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Maybe.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: But the car of this space has a broken rearview mirror on the left.

utt: Yeah.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It used to.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: We got that fixed yesterday too.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Could you wait for a minute, sir?

speaker: speaker_1
utt: I'd like to have a check.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: Sure, go ahead.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: Sorry, sir, my mistake.

speaker: speaker_1
utt: This is your parking space.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: That's all right.

speaker: speaker_2
utt: It's not your fault.
